blogs.title: Galactic Pile-Up May Point to Mysterious New Dark Force in the Universe
blogs.summary: By closely mapping the mass of an enormous galactic collision, astronomers may have uncovered a type of force that only affects dark matter.

blogs.title: Cuspy no more: cored dwarf galaxies in high resolution hydrodynamical simulations

Author: F. Governato, A. Zolotov, A. Pontzen, C. Christensen, S.H. Oh, A.M. Brooks, T. Quinn, S. Shen, J. Wadsley

blogs.title: Dark Matter: Now More Mysterious Than Ever
blogs.summary: Astronomers have one more reason to scratch their heads over the unseen material known as dark matter. Observations of two dwarf galaxies, Fornax and Sculptor, show the dark matter within them is spread out smoothly rather than heaped into a central bulge

blogs.title: La distribuzione della materia scura nelle galassie nane
blogs.summary: Alcuni astronomi della Università del Texas a Austin ritengono di aver trovato la risposta ad un mistero che dura da circa 20 anni relativo alla distribuzione della materia scura nelle galassie […]

blogs.title: Dark matter theory triumphs in sweeping new study
blogs.summary: While stars might cluster in the disk and the normal matter might be restricted to a nearby region around the stars, dark matter extends in a halo more than 10 times the extent of the luminous portion. Image credit: ESO / L. Calçada.When a phen

author.name: Stories by Ethan Siegel on Medium

wikipedia.title: Cuspy halo problem
wikipedia.summary: The cuspy halo problem arises from cosmological simulations that seem to indicate cold dark matter (CDM) would form cuspy distributions — that is, increasing sharply to a high value at a central point — in the most dense areas of the universe.

wikipedia.title: Galaxy rotation curve
wikipedia.summary: The rotation curve of a disc galaxy (also called a velocity curve) is a plot of the orbital speeds of visible stars or gas in that galaxy versus their radial distance from that galaxy's centre.

author.name: Stuart Marongwe
